page.title: 08Woodlands
page.content: Catsey Wood was on record as long ago as 1240.Theyare deciduous woods with a lake and cover 31.0 hectares of land. The standards are mainly oak and ash. Amongst the flowers to be found here are ; orchids, strawberry leaved potentilla and violets. Forty Acre Wood is dedicated woodland, the northern half having been clear-felled in the winter of 1976/77. This led to a temporary loss of much of it's earlier floristic interest.The lake was constructed during the War. It is about 1 hectare in size and has a marshy fringe which sports such plants as willow herb and lesser speedwort. There is an old moated site here also and this is now surrounded by trees.The rough grassland within the woods is not floristically very rich but it helps to add to the variety of the area.
